urlencoded.description: (Required) - The account number of the bank account.
(Required) - Bank code of the account. Accepted value are listed in API Docs.
(Optional) - Inquiry key for handling multiple request with multiple callback.

header.description: String (Required) - Idempotency key. Please see more detail on Idempotent Request API Docs section.
String (Optional) - Request timestamp. The format will follow the ISO8601 format.

urlencoded.description: String (Required) - The account number of the bank account
String (required) - Bank code of the account
Integer (Required) - The amount of money to be disbursed
(Optional) - Remark to be included in the transfer made to the recipient.
(Optional) - City code of the recipient city. Available value can be retrieved from city list API.

query.description: (Required) - Transaction ID
(Required) - Transaction ID

header.description: String (Required) - Idempotency key. Please see more detail on Idempotent Request API Docs section.
String (Optional) - Request timestamp. The format will follow the ISO8601 format.

urlencoded.description: (Required) - The account number of the recipient.
(Required) - Bank code of the recipient bank. Accepted value are listed in API Docs.
(Required) - The amount of money to be disbursed
(Optional) - Remark to be included in the transfer made to the recipient.
(Optional) - City code of the recipient city. Available value can be retrieved from city list API.
(Required) - Country code of the sender’s residence. Available value can be retrieved from country list API

(Optional) - City/country code of the sender’s place of birth. Use city code if the sender’s place of birth is in Indonesia, and country code if outside Indonesia. Available value can be retrieved from city/country list API.
(Optional) - Sender’s date of birth with YYYY-MM-DD format
(Optional) - Sender’s ID type. Accepted value are: nat_id, drv_lic, passport, bank_acc (default).
(Required) - The name of the user of the Money Transfer Company that act as a sender.
(Required) - Sender’s address.
(Optional) - Sender’s ID number. Default value is from attribute account_number.
(Required) - Sender’s job. Accepted values are: housewife, entrepreneur, private_employee, government_employee, foundation_board, indonesian_migrant_worker, company, others.
(Required) - The direction of the transaction. Accepted values are: DOMESTIC_SPECIAL_TRANSFER, FOREIGN_INBOUND_SPECIAL_TRANSFER
(Optional) - List of the recipient emails (separated by comma)

header.description: String (Required) - The Request-ID will be formed of bigflip-{uuid}, where the “uuid” (Universally unique identifier) has to be generated on your end. Example: "Request-ID: bigflip-47EB7F57-5565-4BF0-B9DD-46C6268CEE71".

formdata.description: (Required) - The value should be: 1 (user type Agent)
(Required) - Image file that wants to be uploaded

(Required) - Type of identity. Accepted values:
- "1": National Id Card or KTP in Indonesia
- "2": Passport

(Optional) - Flag denotes the uploaded file is the identity image or selfie with identity image. Accepted values:
- "0": False (default). Denotes that the uploaded file is identity image.
- "1": True. Denotes that the uploaded file is selfie with identity image.

formdata.description: (Required) - Amount of money that wants to be disbursed to the beneficiary (in beneficiary currency). Maximum 2 decimal places, for Japan there can be no decimal. Must be within the minimum and maximum amount based on transaction currency.
(Required) - Source country code using ISO 3166 (Alpha-3). Currently, the possible value is IDN.
(Required) - Destination country code using ISO 3166 (Alpha-3). See supported Destination Countries section in API Docs
(Required) - Transaction type information. Possible values are: C2C, C2B

(Required) - Account number of the beneficiary bank

(Optional) - Postal code of the beneficiary
(Required) - Relationship of beneficiary
(Required) - Source of funds
(Required) - Purpose of remittance

(Required, if the destination country need it) - Identifier of individual account involved in the international transaction
(Required, if the destination country need it) - Identifier of specific bank during an international transaction
(Required, if the destination country need it) - Digits of code which is used by British and Irish banks
(Required, if the destination country need it) - Indian financial system code

(Required, if the destination country need it) - Reference number of document related to the transaction
(Required, if the destination country need it) - Registration number

query.description: (Optional) - The pagination of the result. Default value is 20.
(Optional) - The page number of the result to be viewed.
(Optional) - Sort the result by the attribute. Use the attribute name (e.g sort=id) to sort in ascending order or dash+attribute name (e.g sort=-id) to sort in descending order.

urlencoded.description: (Required) - The title of the bill.

(Required) - Bill type:
- SINGLE: single use
- MULTIPLE: multiple use
For bill created with step 3 only SINGLE is permissible.

(Optional) - Payment amount, minimum Rp10.000 and maximum Rp10.000.000. Leave blank if want to set a flexible amount.
Optional for bill created with Step 1 and mandatory for bill created with Step 2/ Step 3.
(Optional) - Bill expiry date. The bill can’t be used any more beyond the expiry date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm.
(Optional) - Redirect URL after payment is success.

(Optional) - A flag if user needs to input their address when creating payment.
0: false (default)
1: true

(Optional) - A flag if user needs to input their phone number when creating payment.
0: false (default)
1: true

(Required) - Which step the customers will be redirected to when opening the payment link.
1: input-data (default)
2: payment-method
3: payment-confirmation
(Required for step 2-payment method or step 3-payment-confirmation) - Name of the Customer.
(Required for step 2-payment method or step 3-payment-confirmation) - Email of the Customer.
(Required for step 2-payment method or step 3-payment-confirmation) - Phone number of the Customer.
(Required for step 2-payment method or step 3-payment-confirmation) - Address of the Customer.
(Required for step 3-payment-confirmation) - Bank that is used for the payment. Value will be bank_code of Flip.

(Required for step 3-payment-confirmation) - Type of the bank that is used for the payment:
- For bank transfer the value must be set as "bank_account"
- For a virtual account the value must be set as "virtual_account"
- For e-wallet the value must be set as "wallet_account".
- For retail the value must be set as "online_to_offline_account"
- For credit card the value must be set as "credit_card"
(Optional) - The title of the bill.

(Optional) - Bill type:
- SINGLE: single use
- MULTIPLE: multiple use
For bill created with step 3 only SINGLE is permissible.

(Optional) - Payment amount, minimum Rp10.000 and maximum Rp10.000.000. Leave blank if want to set a flexible amount.
Optional for bill created with Step 1 and mandatory for bill created with Step 2/ Step 3.
(Optional) - Bill expiry date. The bill can’t be used any more beyond the expiry date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm.
(Optional) - Redirect URL after payment is success.

(Optional) - Bill activation status:
- ACTIVE
- INACTIVE

(Optional) - A flag if user needs to input their address when creating payment.
0: false (default)
1: true

(Optional) - A flag if user needs to input their phone number when creating payment.
0: false (default)
1: true

query.description: (Optional) - Starting date of the data. Example: "2020-01-01".
(Optional) - Ending date of the data. Example: "2020-12-12". End date must be greater than start_date.
(Optional) - Pagination of the data.
(Optional) - The desired page of the data pagination.
(Optional) - Sort the result by the attribute.
(Optional) - You can sort in: sort_desc (descending), sort_asc (ascending)
(Optional) - Starting date of the data. Example: "2020-01-01".
(Optional) - Ending date of the data. Example: "2020-12-12". End date must be greater than start_date.
(Optional) - Pagination of the data.
(Optional) - The desired page of the data pagination.
(Optional) - Sort the result by the attribute.
(Optional) - You can sort in: sort_desc (descending), sort_asc (ascending)

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Test Payment #1984587554434",
    "type": "single",
    // checkout
    // checkout_seamless
    // direct_api
    "step": "checkout",
    "amount": 50000,
    "redirect_url": "https://flip.id",
    "is_address_required": true,
    "sender_address": "Foo Bar",
    "is_phone_number_required": true,
    "sender_phone_number": "08578674658",
    "sender_name": "User Test",
    "sender_email": "test1234+a@gmail.com",
    "sender_bank": "credit_card",
    "sender_bank_type": "credit_card_account",
    "reference_id": "MerchantRefId05",
   	"item_details": [
      {
            "id": null,
            "name": "test 1",
            "price": 10000,
            "quantity": 1,
            "desc": "Lorem ipsum",
            "image_url": "https://placehold.co/400x400?text=Product"
        },
        {
            "id": "SKU002",
            "name": "test36",
            "price": 10000,
            "quantity": 1,
            "desc": "Dolor amet",
            "image_url": "https://placehold.co/400x400?text=Product"
        }
    ]
}

request.description: Edit Bill can be used to update amount, bill type or bill status. Bill that can be edited only bill from 'checkout' and 'checkout_seamless' step.

query.description: yyyy-mm-dd
yyyy-mm-dd
